input.sentences: [male] remembers the time he used to live with his mother . here he is on his mother 's sofa couch .
bobbies aunt flo | and uncle [male] used to come by there all the time .
now [male] is on his own and has his own apartment . his girlfriend [female] is always with him .
[male] even hangs in front of his place with his friends everyday and does n't haft to worry about his mother having any problems with his company .
[male] and his girlfriend [female] go to the beach and have a good time . [male] has no curfew now that he has his own place .
output.sentences: Sitting on the sofa, Harold thumbed through a photo album remembering the good times.
He remembered the time that his uncle played games with one of his male roommates.
Harold flipped the page to a picture of his male sibling and his female girlfriend.
On the next page was a picture of his male and female friends standing around drinking - oh how those party days made his mother worry.
On the last page, he was able to remember the time that his girlfriend was hanging out on the beach, smiling at the camera with the help of a male tourist.
